html:
** A large mutual fund managed by T. Rowe Price Group Inc TROW.O that is heavily invested in big tech stocks plunged 10% in value on Tuesday, an unusually big decline for funds that are designed to avoid dramatic price swings

** The Blue Chip Growth Fund TRBCX.O at T Rowe, one of the largest U.S. mutual fund companies, is 45% invested in five U.S. megacaps, or almost double the weighting of those companies in the S&P 500 index .SPX

** The five companies are Microsoft Corp MSFT.O, Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O, Google parent Alphabet Inc GOOGL.O, Apple Inc AAPL.O and Facebook owner Meta Platforms FB.O

** A media relations representative at T. Rowe contacted by Reuters was not immediately available for comment

** According to T Rowe's website, the top 10 holdings of Blue Chip Growth made up 57.1% of the fund as of Nov. 30, and the total net asset value of the fund was $103.9 billion at the time

** Tech stocks .SPLRCT led the three major U.S. stock indexes lower on Tuesday after producer prices data fanned inflation fears, with the Nasdaq .IXIC ending the session down 1.1% (Full Story) .N


(Reporting by Herbert Lash)

(( herb.lash@thomsonreuters.com ; 1-646-223-6019; Reuters Messaging: herb.lash.reuters.com@reuters.net ))
